Journal 

The next chapter in our Vocabulary Workshop book is “Going Green Every Day.” For homework, please read the story and write a journal entry about how you are protecting the environment in your own life. This connects to what we are learning in Social Studies about taking care of the Earth’s resources.

Example Journal

The Earth is my favorite planet, and I want to help keep it happy and healthy!

When I brush my teeth, I turn off the faucet so the water does not run down the drain. I take short showers to save water for the plants, animals, and people who need it. I use my reusable water bottle instead of plastic ones, and I carry it everywhere so I do not make trash. I also help my family put bottles and cans in the recycling bin. It feels like I’m being a recycling superhero!

At home, I remember to turn off the lights when I leave a room. I turn off the air conditioner and use a fan instead, which is cool and saves energy. On the weekend, I ride my bike to the park or walk to my friend’s house instead of using a car. It’s fun to move my body, and it helps the Earth too!

When we go shopping, my family buys fruits and vegetables that are grown near our house. That way, the food doesn’t travel far in trucks, which saves gas and helps the planet.

I like helping the Earth because even small things make a big difference. The Earth is amazing, and we all need to take care of it every day!

Science

Complete the Science worksheet related to forces and motion for the next science class. Also read and complete pages 24-31 in the textbook (Monday)

Chinese

Complete the Chinese writing.

Chinese test next Tuesday.
